snippet: The nine-month deployment of 800 soldiers, battle tanks and other fighting vehicles was not tied to any specific security concern or provocation, the Pentagon said.
abstract: Pentagon says 800 soldiers, about 40 Abrams battle tanks and 40 armored infantry fighting vehicles will be deployed to South Korea in January as part of 'rebalance' of forces across Asia and the Pacific; officials emphasized that plan has been under discussion for a year and is not tied to any specific security concern or provocation from North Korea.
lead_paragraph: The nine-month deployment of 800 soldiers, battle tanks and other fighting vehicles was not tied to any specific security concern or provocation, the Pentagon said.

headline.main: Additional U.S. Battalion Going to South Korea
headline.print_headline: Additional Battalion Going to South Korea

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
